content.text: You want to see your baby initiate and carry out the whole sequence of sitting on their own without outside help.
There are two ways to sit:

ol: From standing on 6 (like crawling) - take our pelvic back and leaning on the arm and pushing up to seat.
From laying on the side when leaning on the arm and pushing up to sitting.

content.text: Learning to coordinate between upper and lower body will be the base for this connection while standing and walking.
Now when our hands are free from supporting us and our shoulder belt muscles are strong enough it’s time to develop our fine motor skills that will help us when we’ll start school.

If you are seeing that your baby has a hard time achieving the specific milestones described in the description or are at the age of 11months and can’t do those things you should consult with your pediatrician or an Infant development guide in order to learn how to help your baby to achieve these important abilities that are the foundation of their physical, sensory and emotional needs:

ul: Getting out of balance and falling back and/or to the sides when seated
Seating most of the time with one hand is supporting him on the floor for balance purposes
Seating in a “W” shape most of the time
The feet are in point or flex a lot
